description.narrative: TCG Holdings, Inc (TCG or the Company) is a Philippine holding company with interests in food service and manufacturing, hotel operations and education. These operations are owned by four operational companies: (i) Cravings Food Services Inc. (Cravings), (ii) Innkeepers Inc. (Innkeepers, a hotel operator), (iii) CNA Culinary Services Inc. (CCA, an education provider specialising in culinary arts), and (iv) the Asian School of Hospitality Arts (ASHA, an education provider specialising in hospitality). The groups operations started when Cravings Bakeshop was established in 1989. TCG is undertaking an expansion project to grow both its education business line and its food service operations. Project

i) Increase access to specialized technical vocational education & training (TVET) or higher education for lower to middle income students in regions not well served by post-secondary education and in fields closely linked to employment needs in Philippines and globally. TCG currently has around 4,700 students (2,150 in CCA and 2,550 in ASHA) enrolled across its 14 operational training schools and plans to expand the capacity up to 10,500 students by 2016; ii) Employment generation, specifically in the catering sectors, through the expansion of the group''s food service business. TCG presently operates 10 coffee shops and 28 restaurants, which it plans add 20 new coffee shops and 16 restaurants in next few years.

name.narrative: TCGs business operations are spread over a number of sites in Metro Manila and beyond. The main head office and CCA training center is located in 287 Katipunan Avenue, Loyola Heights, Quezon City, Metro Manila. The main training center for ASHA is located in Blk. 1 Lot 2 Hollywood Hills Subdivision, Sumulong Highway, Antipolo, Metro Manila. Other training centers are located across Metro Manila (e.g. Kamias, Santolan, Tagaytay) with new campuses being opened in main population centres across the country (Cebu, Makati, Laguna, Pampanga). The Food Service businesses are located in malls and hotels across the country, and TCG plans to develop its own coffee bean and cacao growing plantation facility over 3,000 hectares of farmland that it owns in Bukidnon province in the Northern Mindanao region.
